intro: [WRONG START] Hieracussion macrogrovesianum, commonly known as the Macrogrovesian hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow ray florets and dark brown disk florets, typical of the genus Hieracium. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It is native to parts of Europe and has been introduced to other regions, sometimes becoming invasive. Its botanical features include basal leaves that are usually lance-shaped and rough in texture.
